content:
Symptoms of jaundice commonly include:
Yellow skin and the white part of the eyes (sclera) – when jaundice is more severe, these areas may look brown. Yellow color inside the mouth. Dark or brown-colored urine. Pale or clay-colored stools. Itching (pruritis) usually occurs with jaundice.
title: Jaundice
